== Addressing the GA review ==
Here are my thoughts: *Intro: might indeed be expanded a bit. This is perhaps best done after the article is fully expanded. *Banknote section: my idea is to kill the section and add the 200 kuna image, using the text as a caption. *Tvrđa's dimensions: this question occurred to me too (knowing next to nothing about Tvrđa beforehand, I must admit). Could not find any sources (including Croatian ones) on that. Google Earth says 500 x 350 m IIRC, but I'm not sure if that's proper sourcing. *Needs a more thorough present-day description. That's something I could write. Hopefully there's no rush - I work on quite a few other things on and off, so it will take at least a couple of weeks on my part. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 13:01, 29 August 2010 (UTC) :I agree regarding the intro (that can wait for now) and the banknote section. I'm not sure whether Google Earth is a good enough source for the size since it relies on us deciding where the boundaries are. Thanks for your offer of help with expanding the article too. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 13:08, 29 August 2010 (UTC)
== Infobox military structure ==
I have added 'Infobox military structure' into the article, since Tvrđa is a Military Structure. If 'Infobox' is not appropriate because of other issues, feel free to remove it from the article. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 21:05, 23 September 2010 (UTC) :As I already noted on your talk page, I think it's a great idea. Some of the fields may be a little bit off at the moment (e.g. Ive Mažuran says construction began in 1693 and was finished in 1719 (also: what "finished" means is a matter of definition), but no problem, we'll deal with this later. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 21:49, 23 September 2010 (UTC) ::After the article is fully expanded with expanded 'Intro', the infobox with the map of Croatia will fit much better. Now the intro is to short. Informations like construction began/finished and other infos can easily be corrected. Regards, [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 22:07, 23 September 2010 (UTC) :::Thanks for adding the infobox, Kebeta. Generally I think it's a good idea, although I wonder if there's really space for both the plan and the location map inside the infobox. Perhaps the plan should be moved out? [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 22:18, 23 September 2010 (UTC) ::::As I said above, when 'intro' get its needed expansion, things will look better. If not, we can remove something...[[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 22:28, 23 September 2010 (UTC) ::::True, the infobox is quite big, but Kebeta is making a good point: with an intro of proper size, the page will probably look better. Let's wait and see if that is the case - if not, we'll move it. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 22:31, 23 September 2010 (UTC)
== Title of the article ==
Although '''Tvrđa''' is the most common name for this structure, there are others structures in Croatia bearing the same name. The most famous one is '''Osijek Tvrđa''', but '''Slavonski Brod Tvrđa''' or '''Sisak Tvrđa''' will emerge as an article one day soon. It is like calling a small fort in Dalmatia as 'Gradina' - every third fort is called like that. There is no problem now, but probably name Tvrđa will be a disambiguation page in the future. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 22:26, 23 September 2010 (UTC) :It occurred to me too as I was googling for sources: many "Tvrđa" hits come from the Tvrđa in Slavonski Brod - incidentally, another very interesting [[star fort]] in Croatia. However, that article already exists under the title of [[The Brod Fortress]]. Perhaps both titles should be reconsidered. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 22:41, 23 September 2010 (UTC) ::Yeah...I am not familiar what is the most common English name for the fortress it self, probably some 'German word'. But, we are talking about modern town district also, not only about the fortress. So, Tvrđa should definitely stay because of that, maybe '''Osijek Tvrđa''' to avoid possible problems. In the past, the most important was '''Karlovac Tvrđa''', but that fortress lost some of its significance due to modern consrtuction on its site. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 23:05, 23 September 2010 (UTC) :::All English language sources I've found use Tvrđa, although maybe there are sources I haven't found because I don't know the alternative name they use! Anyway, I think [[Tvrđa, Osijek]] would be the best solution. Tvrđa is obviously a fort, but it's also a district of the city. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 08:25, 24 September 2010 (UTC) ::::Absolutely, the article covers (well, ''should'' cover - we'll get to that) both the fort and the city district, and [[WP:COMMONNAME]] applies at any rate. For the time being there is probably no need to change the title, but [[Tvrđa, Osijek]] (or [[Tvrđa (Osijek)]]) is an option, should the need arise. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 09:13, 24 September 2010 (UTC) :::::Yes, most of new English language sources claim Tvrđa, but they all derived from a Croatian sources on English language (Tvrđa is a Croatian word, not English). The question remains what name was used in the past by Austrians and Ottomans, and than used in history books on English language. Nevertheless, the article should contain Tvrđa in the title, and your proposal (Tvrđa, Osijek) sounds good to me - if change is needed at all. Regards, [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 09:21, 24 September 2010 (UTC) :::::BTW GregorB, you should change [[The Brod Fortress]] into [[Brod Fortress]]. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 09:25, 24 September 2010 (UTC) ::::::I've moved that article to [[Brod Fortress]]. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 10:02, 24 September 2010 (UTC) :::::::Thanks Larry, BTW, you have done a great job on Tvrđa article. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 11:00, 24 September 2010 (UTC) ::::::Thanks - I tried my best but my limited knowledge of Croatian was somewhat of a barrier. Hopefully with your and GregorB's help the article will make GA. It certainly seems to be making good progress. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 11:21, 24 September 2010 (UTC) ::::::For the German-language name, look at the plan in the infobox: its original "caption" reads "Plan der Festung Essegg", i.e. it was simply "Fortress Osijek". German name should be mentioned too in the article, but I could not find a good source for that apart from the image itself. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 11:27, 24 September 2010 (UTC)
== Castles template ==
I wonder if it's worth adding [[:Template:Castles in Croatia]] to the article? Some of the titles of articles listed on the template include "fortress" rather than "castle", and perhaps we could actually rename the template "Castles and forts in Croatia"? [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 21:35, 26 September 2010 (UTC) :A good question. I've been involved with the [[List of castles in Croatia]] article, which also deals with both castles and forts, despite the name. I'll ask the other people involved. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 22:04, 26 September 2010 (UTC) ::I don't think that is a good idea. The fortresses which are included in the [[List of castles in Croatia]] article, were a castles at some point in history (although that article is still a mess, but progress slowly in a good direction). Tvrđa was never "a private fortified residence". [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 22:18, 26 September 2010 (UTC) :::Well, I'm not sure: there's [[Brod Fortress]] and [[Klis Fortress]] in that list, and I don't think these were ever castles. They could be removed, or the article might be renamed to [[List of castles and forts in Croatia]]. I'm not sure which is the better solution myself... [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 22:37, 26 September 2010 (UTC) ::::Klis was a castle for sure (Mislav, Trpimir..), but I am not sure for Brod Fortress, probably wasn't a castle. Anyway I think that Cordless Larry was refering to the template, not to the article. Regards, [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 23:07, 26 September 2010 (UTC) ::::::I was, but presumably the template and the article should feature the same castles (and possibly forts)? [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 23:18, 26 September 2010 (UTC) :::::Yes, but the template is transcluded in the list, and there is a general problem of distinguishing castles from forts. If renaming the template makes sense, then renaming the list makes sense too if it holds the same entries. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 23:17, 26 September 2010 (UTC) ::::::It is not a problem of distinguishing castles from forts when you know thear history well, which we - unfortunately don't know enough. Maybe to see what is the situation in other articles (list of castles in...Spain, Ehgland, France...), and than decide what to do...? [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 23:25, 26 September 2010 (UTC) :::::::Exactly. As you've noted, [[List of castles in Croatia]] is still a bit on the messy side, so things will settle eventually. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 23:29, 26 September 2010 (UTC) ::::::::That is a big problem in Croatia, the only author who writes about castles is prof. Ščitaroci from Arch. fax. in Zagreb, and he only writes about baroque and historicist manors of Northern Croatia. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 23:42, 26 September 2010 (UTC)
== Openstreet map? ==
There is a decent map of Tvrđa at [http://www.openstreetmap.org/?lat=45.56059&lon=18.69599&zoom=17&layers=M openstreetmap.org]. Two minor annoyances: 1) descriptions in Croatian, 2) no scale (which would solve the "how big is this place" problem). Are workarounds possible? If not, would you say it's worth including it in the article? [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 23:04, 27 September 2010 (UTC) :It looks worth including to me. I've no idea about workarounds but since most of the text is street names, I don't really see it as being much of a problem that it's in Croatian. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 23:24, 27 September 2010 (UTC) ::Yes, there is a scale. Click 'Izvoz' in the upper menu, then 'format' and 'Mjerilo 1: ???'. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 06:53, 28 September 2010 (UTC) :::Well, yes, there is a scale - what I meant is that it's not visible in the output as a graphic scale, i.e. a line marked with a distance. And, although it's mostly institution and street names, it would be nice for English-speaking users not having to guess that "Sveučilište J.J. Strossmayer" is "J.J. Strossmayer University". Ideally there should be no text in the map, just markers, say 1-10, and a legend in the caption would describe them... :::Oh well, let's start with what we got at the moment. I'll upload the map to Commons. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 07:09, 28 September 2010 (UTC) :::Can't export, apparently their server is constantly overloaded. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 09:59, 2 October 2010 (UTC) ::::Finally succeeded. Added to the article, sizing and placement are provisional. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 20:51, 9 October 2010 (UTC) :::::Excellent - it looks good. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 21:49, 9 October 2010 (UTC)
== Architects & Area ==
I have made some changes. Apparently von Kaiserfeld was the first architect who made design of the fortress, but according to Vabuan's principles of military engineering. I guess those are general principles, thus Vabuan had nothing to do with the fortress? I also found the area of the fortress - 80 hectare. Regards, [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 15:45, 29 September 2010 (UTC) :The question of architect is something I wanted to discuss too. Many sources mention de Gosseau, but Ive Mažuran's article in ''Vijenac'' speaks of von Kaiserfeld, without any mention of de Gosseau. This is strange. :Mažuran mentions de Vauban's work as a general inspiration - the article text is perhaps not sufficiently clear on that. De Vauban was not directly involved. :The area figure you mentioned is presumably from Krajnik and Obad Šćitaroci. However, this figure obviously has to include fortifications outside of main defensive walls, and is therefore not too illustrative. Given the dimensions of the walled area displayed in e.g. Google Earth, it is significantly smaller, around 15 ha (which is still ''huge'' by any standards). Sadly, no source for that figure, although calling this fortress "huge" can be sourced to Mažuran. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 16:30, 29 September 2010 (UTC) ::Yeah...I agree with you about Vabuan, and tryed to clarify that in the article (look that part again in the article). As for von Kaiserfeld and de Gosseau, I think it was like this: von Kaiserfeld was first architects involved in 1691, and de Gosseau was involved from 1712. Since the first fortress was badly done, the second one on the same place was designed by de Gosseau. Still, we need to cite this, or whetever happened. Regarding the area, the fortification had several forts, one of which (the biggest) is Tvrđa (look at the layout). And the Tvrđa it self had ditches and trenches outside walls. But exact area remains very questionable. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 17:03, 29 September 2010 (UTC)
::BTW, calling this fortress "huge" is not such good idea. Tvrđa wasn't classical fortress, rather 'city-fortress'. There are many other 'city-fortresses' bigger than Tvrđa. Lots of towns had something like that in that time: Vienna, Genoa, Karlovac, even Split...[http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/it/c/c5/Palmanova_aerea.jpg take a look here] and [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/b3/Map_of_Geneva_in_1841.jpg here]. It was more walled city than fortress. On the other side of Danube was a real fortress - much smaller and was used only by military. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 17:23, 29 September 2010 (UTC) :::You're quite correct: Tvrđa is "huge" compared to a traditional fortress. Otherwise, its size is not without precedent. :::I agree that there are problems with "huge", even if it's sourced. It is vague, and MOS explicitly advises against "descriptions" such as this. I'd like to see some exact numbers. For example, how long were the walls (>1 km, surely), and what is the length of the surviving walls. Unfortunately, as I already mentioned, no such luck. But I'd say it would be OK to mention the 80 ha figure, it gives at least a rough idea of the scale. :::Your edit on Vauban makes it much clearer. Role of the architects is also clearer now. Very good. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 18:49, 29 September 2010 (UTC) ::::Regarding above discussion about 'huge fortress', I added a sentence with citation:''"Tvrđa was completed in the 18th century by Austrian Empire as the largest fortress on the border of the Ottoman Empire"''. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 09:33, 11 October 2010 (UTC)
== Osijek districts ==
I added new template 'Osijek districts' and added 'Category:Districts of Osijek' instead 'Category:Osijek'. The article has a lots of information about the fortress, and less on the 'Tvrđa district' it self. What do you think, should we write more about disrtict now? [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 16:16, 29 September 2010 (UTC) :Absolutely, in the "Present day" section. Will get to that. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 16:33, 29 September 2010 (UTC)
== Sections ==
Introduction of the 20th century section is fine, I was planning to do that, but also to keep the Present day section. It looks a bit ugly at the moment, but there are sources available to expand both of them eventually - to what extent I cannot say, but if the current organization doesn't work out in the end we'll think of something else. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 08:12, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :I agree. Anyway, once the 20th century section and Present day section are done, it will look much better. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 08:53, 11 October 2010 (UTC) ::How about making the present day section a level 2 rather than level 3 heading, so that it's distinct from the history section? [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 15:19, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :::Good idea. Present day is not really a part of history. Done. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 16:11, 11 October 2010 (UTC)

[[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 16:16, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :::Now it works. :-) [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 16:37, 11 October 2010 (UTC)
== Lead ==
We should try to expend the lead, since the article is fully expanded now (except for Present day). Since Cordless Larry is a native speaker of English, it would be for the best if he does this job. All new edits will probably be of minor importance for the article, and will not affect the lead? [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 16:47, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :Well, not necessarily: there's Tvrđa the city district, with 10,000 inhabitants - might still get a mention in the intro. Apart from that, I'd say WMF quote should be moved there (as suggested by GAR) because it gives a nice summary of what Tvrđa is and why it's notable. :We're almost there - I'll expand the present day and heritage status sections (sooner rather than later, I hope) and then we'll leave the dirty work to CordlessLarry... :-) [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 17:14, 11 October 2010 (UTC) ::Well, I agree. I was just trying to speed up the process. Are we going to submit the article to the GOCE, or Larry can do this also? BTW, I turned couple of red links into blue ones, which leves only [[Mathias von Kaiserfeld]] as a red one. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 17:29, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :::Good. Red links are not a problem at the moment, except for those in the Districts of Osijek template, perhaps. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 17:37, 11 October 2010 (UTC) ::::I'll have a go at expanding it, and give the rest of the article a grammatical once-over at the same time. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 19:18, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :::::OK, I've now expanded the introduction. Please feel free to leave comments or to tweak or further expand it. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 20:12, 11 October 2010 (UTC) ::::::It is a nice start. Good job. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 20:44, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :::::::A good job on the present day section likewise. It's a matter of days before we're finished. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 09:19, 12 October 2010 (UTC)
== 18th and 19th century functions ==
18th and 19th century functions seems to be a bit disorganized. We have several para's above talking about 18th century and title section below, or am I missing something here? [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 18:21, 11 October 2010 (UTC) :That's "dirty work" I was referring to... :-) OK, I'm only half joking here: I agree, some sort of reordering or reorganization would help. This paragraph still describes the 18th century, but in a phase when major construction is already finished. As GAR duly notes, an opening sentence should (ideally) introduce/summarize the section. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 18:34, 11 October 2010 (UTC) ::I reorganized history section. We have 'Design and construction' section which deals with the construction of the fort itself, with two subsections (layouts), one in 17th and other in 18th century - hope it's better now. I also reorganized images - feel free to revert this otherwise. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 14:39, 12 October 2010 (UTC) :::Looks very good to me. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 15:08, 12 October 2010 (UTC)
== GAN #2 ==
Done my bit: expanded the last two sections, did some reordering, added the WMF quote to the intro and trimmed some less important stuff from it, etc. The article appears to be all but ready for GAN #2. After GAN #1, I knew that it could be significantly improved, but the end result has exceeded my expectations.
What is left is: *One final copyedit for everything: spelling, grammar, style, flow, formatting, etc. (I guess CordlessLarry is the victim here :-) ) *Possibly some minor content additions and tweaks. *Something else that I forgot?
After that, the GA nomination is in order. My suggestion is to contact the original reviewer, [[User:Tea with toast|Tea with toast]] - I guess he might be interested in taking another look... [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 20:04, 12 October 2010 (UTC) :I agree, I was just writing that below...:-) [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 20:15, 12 October 2010 (UTC)
== Ready to go ==
After today's edits (good job GregorB) which gave a final touch, I think that all questionable points are addressed, and the article should be renominated. Any further improvments are more than welcome, but we shouldn't wait with nomination for GA, because there should be a backlog anyway, and rewiev of the article will not be for several weeks. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 20:10, 12 October 2010 (UTC) :You're right on this point. In fact, one of the reasons I mentioned Tea with toast above is precisely the time factor: he might be quicker in both starting and finishing the review than some random editor. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 20:17, 12 October 2010 (UTC) ::That would be great. He shold be called as soon as the article is renominated. BTW, the final result has exceeded my expectations also. I guess the first nomination helped a lot as guideline for the final result. [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 20:31, 12 October 2010 (UTC) :::Good work guys. Once the issue I've tagged with the population statistics in the [[Tvr%C4%91a#Present_day|Present day]] section is fixed, I'll renominate. [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 07:00, 14 October 2010 (UTC) ::::{{done}} [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 07:18, 14 October 2010 (UTC) :::::One other issue is that there is no date for the statistics. I think that the "today" wording will be picked up on in the GA review. I don't see a date in the source, but is there another way of finding out? [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 07:25, 14 October 2010 (UTC) ::::::Could not find that information. I was hoping that the primary source for this figure is the 2001 census, but no luck, this information isn't available on www.dzs.hr because they release data for ''settlements'', which Tvrđa is not. It is ''probably'' from the census, judging by the household figure which is a standard census item. However, "probably" is worthless for our purposes. Since the exact figure makes little sense without the exact date, one possible way to work around this is to simply say c. 10000 inhabitants, c. 3300 households. ::::::However, there is one more problem with this piece of information: Tvrđa city district is obviously a much wider area than the one within the former walls. It would be interesting to see how many people actually live within the fort, but I couldn't find such data either. ::::::One minor quibble: the intro sentence "From 1526, Tvrđa was...". Tvrđa didn't exist as such back then, so this is a bit confusing, and should be rewritten to say that Tvrđa and the medieval settlement share the same grounds, or something to that effect. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 08:35, 14 October 2010 (UTC) :::::::Is this better? [[User:Kebeta|Kebeta]] ([[User talk:Kebeta|talk]]) 09:31, 14 October 2010 (UTC) ::::::::Well, yes, it's just that I'm not sure whether Tvrđa was in the ''vicinity'' of the original settlement, or was built ''around'' it. Maybe this should be clarified too. [[User:GregorB|GregorB]] ([[User talk:GregorB|talk]]) 11:33, 14 October 2010 (UTC) :::::::::I found that in second reference (unesco), but feel free to change it. BTW, I added para about Suleiman Bridge. The sources are very controversial on this, but this bridge might be the main reason for building a fort. Apparently, majority attacks on [[Vienna]] and the rest of the Habsburg Monarchy were conducted throughout this bridge, which was apparently firstly built by the [[Suleiman the Magnificent]], not by the [[Suleiman II]].
